s.text: Between a blurred sagacity That once had power to sound him,And Love, that will not let him be The Judas that she found him,Her pride assuages her almost,As if it were alone the cost.He sees that he will not be lost, And waits and looks around him.

Meanwhile we do no harm; for they That with a god have striven,Not hearing much of what we say, Take what the god has given;Though like waves breaking it may be,Or like a changed familiar tree,Or like a stairway to the sea Where down the blind are driven.

She fears him, and will always ask What fated her to choose him;She meets in his engaging mask All reasons to refuse him;But what she meets and what she fearsAre less than are the downward yearsDrawn slowly to the foamless weirs Of age, were she to lose him.

A sense of ocean and old trees Envelops and allures him;Tradition, touching all he sees, Beguiles and reassures him;And all her doubts of what he saysAre dimmed with what she knows of days--Till even prejudice delays, And fades, and she secures him.

A sense of ocean and old trees Envelops and allures him;Tradition, touching all he sees, Beguiles and reassures him;And all her doubts of what he saysAre dimmed with what she knows of days--Till even prejudice delays, And fades, and she secures him.

Meanwhile we do no harm; for they That with a god have striven,Not hearing much of what we say, Take what the god has given;Though like waves breaking it may be,Or like a changed familiar tree,Or like a stairway to the sea Where down the blind are driven.
